Settings and Config Files¶

There are three configuration files:

pelicanconf Main Pelican configuration file
publishconf Configuration file for publishing to server
themeconf Configuration file for the theme.

pelicanconf.py¶

Main Pelican configuration file

This configuration file is a combination of settings built into Pelican (see the Pelican documentation Settings page), and custom options for the MicroCider implementation.

pelicanconf.THEME = u'themes/SOC'¶

The path to the theme to use to build the site. This is also the location of the themeconf.py config file, which is imported into pelicanconf.

pelicanconf.SITEURL = u'http://localhost:8000'¶

The URL for testing the site. Note that the port number (8000) should match the port specified in fabfile.py This is overridden by the publish config file for actually publishing the site.

pelicanconf.TIMEZONE = u'America/New_York'¶

Timezone for dates etc. Not really used.

pelicanconf.DEFAULT_LANG = u'en'¶

Default language

pelicanconf.DEFAULT_DATE = u'fs'¶

Default date format. Not really used.

pelicanconf.DEFAULT_PAGINATION = False¶

Since it’s not a blog, we don’t want to paginate posts (split across pages)

pelicanconf.PATH = u'../fc-microsites/SOC 2014'¶

The PATH is the location of the content. You can set it on the command line when calling the pelican command, or you can specify it as an option when calling fabric.

pelicanconf.ARTICLE_PATHS = [u'report']¶

The folder that contains the articles (aka chapters, sections, and slides)

pelicanconf.STATIC_PATHS = [u'figures', u'data', u'images']¶

Folders that contain static content, which doesn’t need to be parsed by Pelican. For example, CSV files the just get moved from the content directory to the output directory.

Anything that is in these folders will be moved to a folder of the same name in the output directory.

pelicanconf.STATIC_EXCLUDES = [u'images/backgrounds/smaller versions', u'images/backgrounds/originals']¶

Exclude the following directories from the static paths. This means that static files in these directories will not be copied over to the output directory.

pelicanconf.IGNORE_FILES = [u'_*']¶

See the main Pelican docs for more on these settings.

Basically, they determine where articles are saved to in the output directory and also which URLs will be used to view them on the finished site.

pelicanconf.CATEGORY_URL = u'{slug}/'¶

Chapters and sections are accessible by using the slug name after the site’s root URL

pelicanconf.CATEGORY_SAVE_AS = u'{slug}/index.html'¶

Where to save the file produced from the category.html template.

pelicanconf.AUTHOR_SAVE_AS = u''¶

We do not want to save author pages, since we don’t use authors.

pelicanconf.CATEGORIES_SAVE_AS = u''¶

We do not want an index page for all categories; we will use a custom index.html template to create our own index page.

pelicanconf.TAG_SAVE_AS = u''¶

We do not use tags

pelicanconf.YEAR_ARCHIVE_SAVE_AS = u''¶

We do not use archives

pelicanconf.MONTH_ARCHIVE_SAVE_AS = u''¶

We do not use archives

pelicanconf.DAY_ARCHIVE_SAVE_AS = u''¶

We do not use archives

pelicanconf.ARTICLE_URL = u'{category}/{slug}'¶

Each article (i.e. slide) is saved using the article slug within the category which includes the chapter and section. Note that this is for viewing a single slide at a time, which we pretty much only want for sharing purposes; it’s nice to be able to direct someone to a single page with a slide, as Facebook, for example, will then put that slide’s title in the post, rather than the title for the whole microsite

pelicanconf.ARTICLE_SAVE_AS = u'{category}/{slug}.html'¶

Where to save each slide in the output directory

pelicanconf.PAGE_URL = u'{slug}/'¶

Pages are accessed using the slug

pelicanconf.PAGE_SAVE_AS = u'{slug}/index.html'¶

Where to save page files

pelicanconf.PLUGIN_PATHS = [u'plugins']¶

Folders to look for Pelican plugins in

pelicanconf.PLUGINS = [u'category_meta', u'ordered_categories', u'data_import', u'jinja_tests', u'assets']¶

List of plugins to load when testing. We have a different list for publishing

pelicanconf.CATEGORY_SORT_BY = u'chapterno'¶

The field that the ordered_categories plugin should use to sort chapters and sections by.

pelicanconf.JINJA_FILTERS = {u'debug': <function debug at 0x10a455a28>, u'string_list': <function string_list at 0x10a455b90>, u'cat_level': <function cat_level at 0x10a4512a8>, u'json': <function json at 0x10a4558c0>}¶

This matches names of Jinja2 filters to actual methods as defined in soc_jinja2_filters. The keys in this dict are the strings to use in the actual templates (i.e. {{ article|debug }} will apply the soc_jinja2_filters.debug() function to the article object), and the values are the functions that get called when Jinja sees those filters.

pelicanconf.JINJA_TESTS = {u'filepath': <function filepath at 0x10a46e500>}¶

Test functions to add to the built-in Jinja2 tests. These functions will get called on the objects in the template. So {{ article.figure|filepath }} will call the soc_jinja2_filters.filepath() function on the article.figure string and return the result.

pelicanconf.SITE_SCRIPTS = [u'//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.4/js/bootstrap.min.js', u'//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/proj4js/2.3.6/proj4.js', u'//code.highcharts.com/highcharts.js', u'//code.highcharts.com/highcharts-more.js', u'//code.highcharts.com/modules/data.js', u'//code.highcharts.com/modules/exporting.js', u'//code.highcharts.com/maps/modules/map.js', u'//cdn.jsdelivr.net/blazy/latest/blazy.min.js']¶

List of external javascripts to load on each page

pelicanconf.DELETE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY = True¶

Overwrite the output directory

publishconf.py¶

Configuration file for publishing to server

This file is imported after pelicanconf when building the site to be published to the server, rather than for local testing. It overrides several variables that need to be different when publishing the site, vs. testing it locally.

publishconf.SITEURL = u'http://furmancenter.org/soc2014'¶

The SITEURL here is the actual URL for the live site. This is used in all the links.

publishconf.RELATIVE_URLS = False¶

When publishing, we want to use absolute URLs (with the full SITEURL included), rather than relative URLs

publishconf.DELETE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY = True¶

Clear the output directory so that we have a clean rebuild.

publishconf.PLUGINS = [u'category_meta', u'ordered_categories', u'data_import', u'jinja_tests', u'assets', u'optimize_images']¶

Some plugins, like optimize_images can take some time, so we don’t want to include them when testing locally, but we do when publishing.

themes\SOC\themeconf.py¶

Configuration file for the theme.

This is imported by the main configuration files.

themeconf.AUTHOR = u'NYU Furman Center'¶

Author, not really used

themeconf.SITENAME = u"State of New York City's <br>Housing &amp; Neighborhoods in 2014"¶

The main branding text

themeconf.SITEDESC = u"The NYU Furman Center's annual report on New York City and its neighborhoods."¶

Site description (used in meta tags)

themeconf.DEFAULT_IMAGE = 'images/figures/overview_landuse_landuse1.png'¶

This is the default image to share to Facebook

themeconf.CSS_URLS = ['//maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.4/css/bootstrap.min.css', '//cdn.jsdelivr.net/jquery.gray/1.4.2/gray.min.css']¶

List of external CSS stylesheets to load

themeconf.THEME_STATIC_PATHS = ['static']¶

Static path in the theme folder. The contents of this folder will be copied to the output directory. It normally includes things like CSS stylesheets, site-wide javascript files, etc.

themeconf.BRAND_IMAGE = 'images/theme/FurmanCenter_Icon_CMYK_TranspOrange.png'¶

The site logo. This path is with respect to the content path (i.e. PATH)

themeconf.CHAPTER_LINK_IMAGES = ['images/theme/Density.png', 'images/theme/CitywideOverview.png', 'images/theme/Data.png']¶

List of images to use for chapter links, both on the index page and in the top navbar. Any chapters without images will just have the chapter name as the link.

themeconf.FAVICON = 'images/theme/favicon.ico'¶

Location of the favicon, relative to the content directory (i.e. PATH)

themeconf.DIRECT_TEMPLATES = 'index'¶

These are templates that are processed directly, without any content like articles, pages, etc. Basically, they are templates that do not receive any objects created by Pelican except for the default objects. In our case, the only page we want to render directly is the index page (i.e. the home page for the microsite).

themeconf.SLUGIFY_SOURCE = 'basename'¶

This tells Pelican to use the filename to set the article slug. The slug will be the filename without the extension.

themeconf.ARTICLE_ORDER_BY = 'slug'¶

Within sections, sort articles (i.e. slides) by slug (as opposed, for example to by date, which doesn’t make sense in our context). Slugs will be sorted alphabetically.

themeconf.FORMATTED_FIELDS = ['title', 'summary']¶

Which metadata fields can have markdown formatting (or HTML) in them

themeconf.THEME_SCRIPTS = ['/theme/js/grouped_categories/grouped-categories.js', '/theme/js/figures.js', '/theme/js/scripts.js']¶

Scripts within the theme’s static folder that should be loaded onto every page. Note that these are paths relative to the output directory; by defaut all the files in the THEME_STATIC_PATHS directories are saved into the /theme/ subfolder of the output directory.

themeconf.DEFAULT_LAYOUT = 'no-figure'¶

The default layout for slides. Note that if there is a figure specified, whatever it is, the DEFAULT_FIGURE_LAYOUT will be used instead. The layout is simply the name of a template in the slide-templates folder

themeconf.DEFAULT_FIGURE_LAYOUT = 'figure-right'¶

The default layout to use for slides with non-empty figure fields.

themeconf.DEFAULT_FIGURE_NOTES = ''¶

Notes to go on every figure. NB: If you set DEFAULT_FIGURE_NOTES to be non-empty, specifying the notes on any specific figure will OVERRIDE the default; if you want the default PLUS specific notes, you have to manually insert the default into the specific figure’s markdown file.

themeconf.DEFAULT_BACKGROUNDS = ['images/backgrounds/BklynBridge.jpg', 'images/backgrounds/BKNavyYard.jpg']¶

A list of the images to cycle through for the background if none is specified on a particular slide

themeconf.DATA_PATH = 'data'¶

The path that the data_import.data_import Pelican plugin should look in for data files.
